definition: to get over (a shock, bereavement etc)/to avoid dwelling on unpleasant things/to accept the situation and move on
to think/to believe/to suppose/to wish/to want/to miss (feel wistful about the absence of sb or sth)

to open/to start/to turn on/to boil/to write out (a prescription, check, invoice etc)/to operate (a vehicle)/carat (gold)/abbr. for Kelvin, 開爾文|开尔文[Kai1 er3 wen2]/abbr. for 開本|开本[kai1 ben3], book format

sentences.english: Narrator: Froggy want to be a pilot, he want to fly plane.
sentences.chinese: 想当一个飞行员，他想开飞机。

sentences.english: Certainly, sir. Would you like to open a time deposit savings account or a checking account?
sentences.chinese: 好的，先生。您想开定存储蓄户头还是支票户头？

sentences.english: Liu Mei discovered when suddenly want to back to chop wood field who drains.
sentences.chinese: 陆梅忽然想开初到砍木场时发现的阿谁下水口。

sentences.english: In many regions, stores can now open or close whenever they want.
sentences.chinese: 现在，许多地区的店铺都可以想开到几点就开到几点。

sentences.english: You want to have a status meeting every day?
sentences.chinese: 你每天都想开一次碰头会。

sentences.english: I thought he’d get over it.
sentences.chinese: 我还以为他早已经想开了。

sentences.english: I want to open a checking account. What should I do?
sentences.chinese: 我想开个支票账户。我应该怎么办理呢？

sentences.english: No problem, sir. What sort of time deposit account would you like to open?
sentences.chinese: 没问题，先生。您想开哪种定存帐户呢？

sentences.english: I'd like to open a current account.
I want to open a current account.
I'd like to open a current savings account.
sentences.chinese: 我想开个活期储蓄账户。

sentences.english: Just as it is important to be strong and clear, it is essential to be open-minded.
sentences.chinese: 正如坚定清晰很重要一样，思想开放也同样必要。

sentences.english: I'd like to have a three year time deposit in the amount of two thousand pounds.
sentences.chinese: 我想开一个两千英镑的三年定期存款帐户。

sentences.english: I have to like to open a current account.
sentences.chinese: 我想开唯一活期存款帐户。

sentences.english: I would like to open a current account.
sentences.chinese: 我想开一个活期存款帐户。

sentences.english: Whvia sort of medicine do you take?

definition: to reopen/to start again
to come to accept an unpleasant fact/to get over sth/to cheer up
cannot figure out/to be unable to take a lighter view/to take things too hard/to be depressed/to fret over trifles
to close down a business for good and put the best face on it (idiom)
to open shop
to joke/joke/jest
to lose money/to pay for damages
to open a business/first transaction of a business day
business/CL:筆|笔[bi3]
life force/vitality
variant of 老闆|老板[lao3 ban3]
Robam (brand)
boss/business proprietor/CL:個|个[ge4]
to think to oneself/to think/to assume
(dialect) to step aside/Get out of the way!
to figure out/to realize/to become convinced/to come round (to an idea)/to get over it
to make a loss
to go bankrupt/to close down
online shop
